front.title: A Modest Proposal for Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) Work in the IETF

abstract.t: The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) has become widely deployed onthe Internet, covering a wide range of usages from toll bypass toinstant messaging, from service provider to enterprise. However, itsrealization in actual deployments differs in important ways from thespecifications. This has created a gulf between existing and ongoingstandards work, and real live deployments. This document argues thatthe RAI area should focus on solving real world interoperabilityissues and address real world functional gaps.
